rightsList.rights: {/codeBook/stdyDscr/dataAccs/useStmt/restrctn} The data are unrestricted for academic purposes only and licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution + NonCommercial 4.0 International License. The users should use the materials only for the purposes specified in Ordering form, to act at all times so as to preserve the confidentiality of individuals and institutions recorded in the materials. MATERIALS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
{/codeBook/stdyDscr/dataAccs/useStmt/citreq} The users should acknowledge in any publication both the original depositors and the Archive.

{/codeBook/stdyDscr/dataAccs/useStmt/deposReq} Users are requested to deposit with the Archive two copies of any published work or report based wholly or in part on such materials and to notify the Archive of any errors discovered in the materials.
{/codeBook/stdyDscr/dataAccs/useStmt/conditions} In case of ambiguity the users of the data set are advised to contact principal investigators or Archive.

descriptions.description: {/codeBook/stdyDscr/stdInfo/abstract}The data has been gathered in order to analyse newspaper delivery labour by focusing on two Slovenian companies: the media company Dnevnik and the distribution company Izberi. In response to the enduring trend of declining readership, Dnevnik attempted to cut its delivery costs by transferring the delivery activity to a rival company Izberi, a move met with resistance from deliverers adversely affected by the transfer. Building primarily on labour process theory the purpose of data gathering was to identify the economic rationalisation techniques used to reduce the costs of delivery labour, discipline the workforce and respond to the newspaper deliverers’ resistance to these techniques.

{/codeBook/stdyDscr/method} <method source="producer"> <dataColl source="producer"> <timeMeth xml:lang="en-GB" source="producer">Cross-section. One-time data collection.</timeMeth> <dataCollector abbr="CDK" xml:lang="en-GB" source="producer">Center za raziskovanje družbenega komuniciranja = Social Communication Research Centre</dataCollector> <sampProc xml:lang="en-GB" source="producer">Non-probability: Purposive. Non-probability: Respondent-assisted. Newspaper deliverers were included by the snowball method. Other respondents were invited according to their function in Dnevnik, d.d. and Izberi, d.o.o.</sampProc> <collMode xml:lang="en-GB" source="producer">Face-to-face interview.</collMode> <resInstru xml:lang="en-GB" source="producer">Semi-structured questionnaire.</resInstru> <collSitu source="producer">First contacts of newspaper deliverers were provided by a representative of the Association of Free Trade Unions of Slovenia, who helped in organizing collective action (resistance of newspaper deliverers). Sampling continued on by using the snowball method. Interviewees that were sampled purposively (representatives of trade unions of the media company Dnevnik, representatives of the media companies Dnevnik, d.d., and Izberi, d.o.o), were contacted by using publicly accessible contacts (e-mail, telephone). The willingness to cooperate of all of the interviewees to cooperate was high. On average, the interviews lasted a good hour. </collSitu> <weight xml:lang="en-GB" source="producer">No.</weight> <cleanOps xml:lang="en-GB" source="producer">The data were cleaned for out of range values before deposited.</cleanOps> </dataColl> <anlyInfo source="producer"> <respRate xml:lang="en-GB" source="producer">/</respRate> </anlyInfo> <stdyClas xml:lang="en-GB" type="ADP" source="producer">7: studies that permits theoretical generalisations or relates on a practical problem, less influential</stdyClas> </method>
